revised_title: The Croonian Lecture: On the Coagulation of Blood and Formation of Muscular Fibers
tldr: The author investigates the coagulation process of blood and the formation of muscular fibers, suggesting that the globules in the blood may be the primary components of these fibers. The study also examines the role of attraction between globules in the coagulation process and the similarities between brain tissue and blood globules.
